contentrichtext.text: {{cleanup|date=November 2011}} {{Infobox software | developer = [[Mozilla Foundation]] and community | released = February 2006 | latest release version = 21.0<ref>https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/xulrunner/releases/21.0/</ref> | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2013|05|11}} | latest preview version = 22.0b1<ref>https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/xulrunner/releases/22.0b1/</ref> | latest preview date = {{Start date and age|2013|05|14}} | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | programming language = [[C++]], [[XUL]], [[XBL]], [[JavaScript]] | genre = [[Runtime environment]] | license = [[Mozilla Public License|MPL]] | website = {{URL|developer.mozilla.org/en/XULRunner}} }} '''XULRunner''' is a [[runtime environment]] developed by the [[Mozilla Foundation]] to provide a common back-end for [[XUL]]-based applications. It replaced the ''Gecko Runtime Environment'', a stalled project with a similar purpose.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://developer.mozilla.org/en/GRE |title=GRE — Mozilla Developer Center |publisher=Developer.mozilla.org |date= |accessdate=2011-02-28}}</ref> The first stable developer preview of XULRunner was released in February 2006, based on the Mozilla 1.8 code base. XULRunner is a "technology experiment", not a shipped product,<ref>{{cite newsgroup|newsgroup=mozilla.dev.planning|id=mailman.909.1309204932.4544.dev-planning@lists.mozilla.org|title=Re: lifecycle policy for XULRunner apps?|author=Benjamin Smedberg|url=https://groups.google.com/group/mozilla.dev.planning/msg/773734e58af45bb2?dmode=source&output=gplain&noredirect}}</ref> meaning there are no "official" XULRunner releases, only stable builds based on the same code as a corresponding Firefox release. ==Uses== All XUL-based applications like [[Mozilla Firefox]], [[Mozilla Thunderbird]], [[Songbird (software)|Songbird]], [[Flickr]] Uploadr, [[SeaMonkey]], [[Conkeror]], [[Mozilla Sunbird|Sunbird]], [[Democracy Player|Miro]], [[Joost]], and [[TomTom#TomTom HOME|TomTom Home 2.0]] run on XULRunner. Starting with version 3.0, Mozilla Firefox uses a "private" XULRunner,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://wiki.mozilla.org/XULRunner:Roadmap |title=XULRunner:Roadmap - MozillaWiki |publisher=Wiki.mozilla.org |date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2011-02-28}}</ref> meaning the framework is installed locally in the application directory. The fourth version of the [[video game]] series Simon the Sorcerer, ''[[Simon the Sorcerer 4: Chaos Happens]]'', uses XULrunner. The [[eMusic]] website has a download application called [[eMusic Remote]] that uses XULRunner. The [[Google Adwords]] Editor uses XULRunner,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://code.google.com/p/xulrunner-adwords-editor/ |title=xulrunner-adwords-editor — Project Hosting on Google Code |publisher=Code.google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-28}}</ref> as does the [[Evergreen (software)|Evergreen ILS]], a free and open-source library automation system. In addition, the XULRunner package provides access to [[ActiveX]] Control functionality previously found in a (now defunct) third-party ActiveX Control built off the Mozilla source code. Applications using this [[application programming interface]] (API) may function with XULRunner installed and registered. Starting with [[Lotus Notes]] version 8.5.1, [[IBM]] deployed XULRunner to provide Notes client support for [[XPages]] applications. XULRunner is used in [[Google Chrome]] web browser according to the credits, URL = "chrome://credits/" ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Mozilla application framework]] (XPFE) * [[Mozilla Prism]] * [[Gecko (layout engine)]] * [[HTML Application]] * [[Adobe Integrated Runtime]] (AIR) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://wiki.mozilla.org/XUL:Xul_Runner XULRunner wiki site] * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XULRunner XULRunner Documentation] * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XULRunner_Hall_of_Fame XULRunner Hall of Fame] * [http://benjamin.smedbergs.us/blog/2007-05-15/xulrunner-what-we-are-doing/ XULRunner: What we are doing] (Mozilla plans for the 1.9 timeframe) * [http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/xulrunner/ XULRunner source code] * [http://video.kiberpipa.org/media/SU_Harnessing_the_Mozilla_platform/play.html Brian King 2005 Media] * [http://brian.mozdev.org/presentations/cyberpipe2005/slides.html Brian King 2005 Presentations Slides] {{Mozilla projects}} {{Rich Internet applications}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Xulrunner}} [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]] [[Category:Free system software]] [[Category:Mozilla]] [[Category:Markup languages|*]] [[Category:Widget engines]]
